Uses of Package
peregrine.util

Packages that use peregrine.util
peregrine.client.proto Wire protocol for GET/SCAN/PUT responses from the region servers. 
peregrine.config Contains the configuration backend for peregrine and all associated classes; The API needs to pass Config objects within the system and this is the main way of obtaining them. 
peregrine.controller Main interface for the controller which allows one to kick off and execute jobs in the cluster. 
peregrine.http A new and cleaner HTTP client that doesn't require an extra queue and uses isWritable correctly. 
peregrine.io.buffer Buffer related IO classes. 
peregrine.io.util IO utilities, usually for dealing with multiple files, closing resoures, etc. 
peregrine.merge   
peregrine.os Operating system specific extentions including mlock, fadvise, fallocate, etc. 
peregrine.rpc Basic RPC client framework which uses JSON over HTTP to encode and decode messages sent over the wire - this is not meant to be used for high throughput messages but instead meant for control messages between workers and the controller. 
peregrine.task Task framework for map/reduce/merge. 
peregrine.util Util classes for use (crypto, queues, etc). 
peregrine.util.netty Extensions and additional code for using Netty and async IO. 
peregrine.worker Worker daemon including PFS (partitioned filesystem) support as well as main daemon interface (RPC, etc). 
 

Classes in peregrine.util used by peregrine.client.proto
TypedValueMap
          Map for handling keys and values where the values may be arbitrary types.
 

Classes in peregrine.util used by peregrine.config

          Track memory allocations of direct memory.
StructMap
          Simple map for dealing with primitive types stored in a type or anonymous map.

          Simple interface for service that can startup and shutdown.
